ygData.subject: Re: Kithicor
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Unfortunately I was showing a friend around when I ran into Ged and Luna(?), so I didn t get a chance to follow them and note their wandering habits. ...
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 12 Jul 1999, Elijah Meeker wrote:
>
> The behaviors of Ged and Luna??? (I forget her exact name
> BUT we all believe it is not accidental that she has the
> moon reference in her name). We are quite sure they are
> involved...and when she is parted from him for a while she
> *runs* back. What is the story behind that?

Unfortunately I was showing a friend around when I ran into
Ged and Luna(?), so I didn't get a chance to follow them and
note their wandering habits.

> Ghouls that stand upright (spotted one night).

I've seen it several times. Always by the lake where the
skeletons form in piles, and zombies and mummies sit down.
I will try charming a ghoul soon (one bubble til 27) and
commanding it to sit down and see what it looks like.

The lake is also something I've been meaning to explore a
little better. The water is murky so it's easy to miss
something.

> One minute Ged is standing there happily, the next moment,
> a werewolf...(seen by a friend)

Wow, neat. I'll have to try asking Kithicor about a few
things in the hopes I can stumble across a keyword. The
biggest frustration in tracking down these folks in Kithicor
is that I cannot track.

> One night I saw Luna?? run into a burned out house and a
> female zombie run out.

Hmm, I ran into Ged again a few hours later, and he was alone.
I found Luna some distance away. I figured they walked
different routes and the first time I just happened to catch
them at the same place at the same time.

> And why doesn't she speak?

Lots of NPCs don't speak - Rivervale is full of them. I
didn't think much of it at the time, figuring it was as yet
unimplemented.

> *one* goblin? How often do you see a lone goblin? Not
> named, just a regular ol' goblin. Is he lost?

Pretty frequently actually. Each undead camp seems to have
several individual spawn "spots." Each "spot" can spawn
anywhere from 1 to 7 (most I've seen) undead, always of the
same type. The druid stones in North Ro operate the same way,
though you may be right - I don't recall ever seeing ghouls
spawn there in anything but groups of two.

There are wisps in Kithicor too - very rare but occasionally
you will see them. The place actually reminds me a lot of
Lesser Faydark, but with a lot more fog. LFay also has orc
and undead camps, and a ranger(?) outpost, as well as the
faerie and brownie villages. It is also a zone well worth
exploring from L8 on up if you are into avoiding crowds.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
